# tableView(_:heightOfRow:)

**Instance Method**

Asks the delegate for the height of the specified row.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor optional func tableView(_ tableView: NSTableView, heightOfRow row: Int) -> CGFloat
```

## Parameters

- **tableView**: The table view that sent the message.
- **row**: The row index.

## Return Value

The height of the row. The height doesn’t include intercell spacing and must be greater than zero.

## Discussion

Implement this method if your table supports varying row heights.

Although table views may cache the returned values, you should ensure that this method is efficient. When you change a row’s height you must invalidate the existing row height by calling [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/noteHeightOfRows(withIndexesChanged:)].  [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView] automatically invalidates its entire row height cache in response to calls to [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/reloadData()] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/noteNumberOfRowsChanged()].

If you call [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/view(atColumn:row:makeIfNecessary:)] or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTableView/rowView(atRow:makeIfNecessary:)] within your implementation of this method, the table view throws an exception.
